intro: Nepeta nuda subsp. nuda, commonly known as the naked catmint, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually violet or blue, arranged in whorled clusters at the ends of the stems. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of nectar for pollinators.
